answers.answer: Hi,To answer your question, yes, weight loss like that can throw your menstrual cycle off.  I would also take a pregnancy test as you said you are going to.  Way to go on the weight loss and exercise!  Keep up the good work :)

Thank you for your support :) I took a pregnancy test and it came out neg so I can rule out pregnancy now and ease my mind lol, now I know it can very well be the fact that I lost the weight as to why I only bleed for about 3hrs :)

question: So I started exercising feb 18th monday-friday only and I walk 3 miles and about 2 days ago I started riding my bike. Since feb 18th I have lost about 10-12 pounds which I am really happy because hopefully I can control my diabetes and have a child when I'm healthy. On the 2nd of march I stared to bleed and thought I was getting my period but since then I have not bleed at all, I didn't even fill one regular tampon that evening. And I have had unprotected sex with my husband but I don't feel pregnant. Before the 2nd of march I did feel cramps for 3 days and I was PMS. My question is since I lost 10 pounds in about 2 weeks, would that have messed with my menstrual cycle? Please any advise will help me a lot. I do plan to take a pregnancy test within a week to rule out pregnancy.
title: period only for a few hrs
